To round out the rest of the band is Leonard Marsh, Jr. on drums and YankÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s granddaughter Sheena Rachell on bass. Not too many instruments, but just enough to make it blue.
There is an amazing thing on this album: tempo. Every song keeps your foot tappinÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ along no matter where the tempo is. Find a picture of Sleepy John EstesÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ house in Brownsville, Tennessee, and you could picture this music coming off the front porch in the mid 1980s. This contains fine material by one of the few great mandolin bluesmen.
